result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose L. Casas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment, unless medically excused by a treating physician.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant to maintain timely, uninterrupted payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 2002PA14PJ. Orders subject to modification in the future by further order of the Court. All payments are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collections Trust Fund (WISCTF), not through the Department of Corrections.

Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent. Defendant to maintain a working address with the Waushara County Child Support Agency.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. No Good Time Credit.

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 11:15 am case called. Defendant Jose L. Casas in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on the record-argued sentence.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Guilty to Count 1 & Count 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 3, 4, & 5. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Johnson. No statement by defendant. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 3 years. CONDITIONS: COUNT 1 ONLY-60 days WCJ, with Huber. No Good Time Credit. No credit for time served. Concurrent to any sentence being served. CONDITIONS ON EACH COUNT: Pay Child Support as ordered in Waushara County 02PA14. Working address with Child Support. Maintain full-time employment.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. $400 Extradition Costs included.  Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Case Called @ 2:05 PM:  Defendant Jose L. Casas in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  P/S scheduled as requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on July 25, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Case called @ 3:04 p.m. Defendant Jose L. Casas in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson. Atty Johnson appears telephonically.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Johnson requesting an in-person STC.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
From District Attorney's office for reimbursement of extraditions costs-$400.00 from Lock & Load
Status conference on June 12, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

1:14 pm case called. Defendant Jose L. Casas in court with attorney Alex E. Johnson.  Defendant Jose L. Casas in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the complaint, finds probable cause, and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Johnson confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters plea of Not Guilty to all counts.    STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for June 12, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jose L. Casas
Current: 248 46th Ave, Bellwood, IL 60104 United States  (Effective: 05-10-2017)
Prior: 40 46th Avenue, Bellwood, IL 60104
Initial appearance on May 16, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Maintain child support payments as ordered in Waushara Co Case No. 2002PA000014PJ.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:16 PM: Defendant Jose L. Casas in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Defendant Jose L. Casas in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per SPD:  Custody status will depend on eligibility for services.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   ADA argues as to Signature Bond due to 6 mos Commitment required as to the underlying child support case.  No objection to bond request of the State.  IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Body Only with Extradition Within the Continental United States

Case Called @ 1:15 PM: Defendant Jose L. Casas not in court.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, Arrest Warrant authorized with Extradition Within the Continental U.S.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
